subject: Re: [junit] Global variable?
msgSnippet: Ahh, yes, valid point. That is how I did it with my own harness as well. Each run gets a new classloader instance. ... __________________________________ Do
messageBody:
Ahh, yes, valid point. That is how I did it with my
own harness as well. Each run gets a new classloader
instance.

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

> Kevin Duffey wrote:
> > I could be wrong. There is a UI that you can
> select
> > "reload...". Part of the JUnit GUI runner I think,
> in
> > which case each TestCase get's it's own
> classloader
> > instance each time it runs. I thought I read each
> run
> > get's its own loader instance anyway to "sandbox"
> it
> > so that across runs one testcase run can not
> affect
> > another testcase run. However, again, I may be
> wrong
> > on this.
>
> Well, that "reload classes" button means that
> classes are reloaded for
> each test /run/, and not for each individual test.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for
> Programmer Testing
